info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 18 at 11:31PM PST until December 20 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy wet snow possible Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. A brief period of freezing rain is also possible Sunday night. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 8 inches possible, with the lowest amounts most likely occurring along the Columbia River and the highest amounts occurring for elevations above 500 feet. In addition to the snow, a light glaze of ice is also possible Sunday night if snow does temporarily switch over to freezing rain. * WHERE...In Washington, Central Columbia River Gorge. In Oregon, Central Columbia River Gorge. * WHEN...From Sunday afternoon through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...There is still some uncertainty regarding exact snow amounts and snow levels, as well as the freezing rain potential. There is a chance for accumulations as high as 6 inches along the Columbia River, but the most likely outcome would be amounts closer to 1 inch along the river and amounts closer to 6 to 8 inches for elevations above 500 feet.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
